Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Alright I ve got this task to analyze an event log for a loan application process There are some strict rules that must always be followed and some recommendations that are nice to follow but not mandatory My job is to look at the event log and identify where these rules are being broken or where the recommendations are not being met

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: First I need to make sure I understand the strict rules which are the normative process behaviors The process always starts with receiving a loan application After that a credit check must be performed before any risk evaluation So credit check comes before risk assessment Then based on the risk assessment a loan decision is made either approved or rejected After the decision the applicant must be informed If the loan is approved there s an extra step finalizing documentation before closing the case But if it s rejected you just close the case without finalizing documentation

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: So the sequence is 1 Application Received 2 Credit Check 3 Risk Assessment 4 Loan Decision 5 Inform Applicant 6 If Approved Finalize Documentation 7 Close Case

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: And there are some specific rules Credit Check must be before Risk Assessment Risk Assessment before Loan Decision Inform Applicant after Loan Decision If approved Finalize Documentation before Close Case If rejected don t finalize documentation before closing the case

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Alright now looking at the event log Case 1 This seems to follow the sequence perfectly Credit Check before Risk Assessment Risk Assessment before Loan Decision Inform Applicant after Loan Decision Finalize Documentation before Close Case and since it was approved all steps are there

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Case 2 Hmm here there are two issues First Risk Assessment is before Credit Check but according to the rules Credit Check must be before Risk Assessment So that s a violation of the normative process Second even though the loan was rejected they still finalized documentation which is not allowed So that s another violation

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Case 3 In this case the sequence seems correct Credit Check before Risk Assessment Risk Assessment before Loan Decision Inform Applicant after Loan Decision Finalize Documentation before Close Case But there are some timing issues

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: First the Credit Check happened on the 12th at 09 00 and then on the 14th at 10 00 That s more than 24 hours later which is not ideal but since it s a desideratum not a hard rule it s not a serious violation

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Second Inform Applicant was at 16 00 on the 16th which is more than 48 hours after the Loan Decision at 12 00 on the 14th Again not ideal but just a desideratum

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Also there s no Follow up Call but since it s recommended but not required it s not a problem

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: So for normative rules only Case 2 has violations Case 3 has some timing issues that are just recommendations

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Now for part 2 the desiderata It s preferred that Credit Check is completed within 24 hours after receiving the application Inform Applicant should be done within 48 hours after the Loan Decision It s encouraged to perform a Follow up Call before closing the case but it s not mandatory

Name: Validation - PE
Text: So in Case 1 everything seems timely and there s no mention of a Follow up Call but since it s not required it s okay

Name: Validation - PE
Text: In Case 2 no issues with timing but sequence violations

Name: Validation - PE
Text: In Case 3 Credit Check was more than 24 hours after Application Received and Inform Applicant was more than 48 hours after Loan Decision So these are desideratum violations No Follow up Call in Case 3 but again it s not required

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: So summarizing Normative Rule Violations Case 2 Risk Assessment before Credit Check Finalized documentation after rejection Desideratum Violations Case 3 Credit Check more than 24 hours after Application Received Inform Applicant more than 48 hours after Loan Decision No Follow up Call but this is not a problem since it s not required

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Now for interpretations or justifications For Case 2 the sequence violations might be due to human error or perhaps system issues where activities were recorded in the wrong order The finalization of documentation after rejection could be a mistake or perhaps an attempt to keep the applicant engaged but it s against the rules

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: For Case 3 the delays could be due to busy staff backend processing times or perhaps waiting for additional information from the applicant Since these are just recommendations it s understandable but ideally they should aim to meet these time frames

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Overall the process seems mostly followed with only one case having serious violations and another having some minor timing issues
